articles.headline: Presidential Primaries Lift CNN
articles.snippet: After a long malaise, CNN is finally getting its swagger back, in large part from high ratings from this year’s presidential race.
articles.abstract: After a long malaise, CNN is finally getting its swagger back, in large part from high ratings from this year’s presidential race.
articles.lead_paragraph: The morning after the Democratic primary debate on Feb. 21, while both sides argued over who had come out ahead, there was one clear winner: CNN. The debate, broadcast by CNN and Univision, the Spanish-language network, drew 7.6 million viewers, one of the biggest audiences ever for a primary debate on a cable network.

articles.headline: Assurances From Citigroup, but Skepticism on Wall Street
articles.snippet: Investors and analysts have urged a breakup of Citigroup, saying the company has become too unwieldy to be managed effectively.
articles.abstract: Investors and analysts have urged a breakup of Citigroup, saying the company has become too unwieldy to be managed effectively.
articles.lead_paragraph: Sanford I. Weill built Citigroup into one of the world’s largest banking companies. Now, Vikram S. Pandit is watching Mr. Weill’s creation wither in the stock market.

articles.headline: Yahoo Looks at New Way to Survive
articles.snippet: As it scrambles to avoid defeat in its battle with Microsoft, Yahoo may try to seek more time to find other partners or persuade Microsoft to raise its offer.
articles.abstract: As it scrambles to avoid defeat in its battle with Microsoft, Yahoo may try to seek more time to find other partners or persuade Microsoft to raise its offer.
articles.lead_paragraph: As it scrambles to avoid defeat in its battle with Microsoft, Yahoo may try to put a little more time on the clock.

articles.headline: Unemployed, and Skewing the Picture
articles.snippet: When the latest monthly employment report comes out this week, politicians will be quick to point out that joblessness remains low by historical standards, but the figures can be misleading.
articles.abstract: When the latest monthly employment report comes out this week, politicians will be quick to point out that joblessness remains low by historical standards, but the figures can be misleading.
articles.lead_paragraph: (UPDATED March 7, 9:55 a.m.) This month's jobs report is a great example of how misleading the unemployment rate can be. In February, the economy shed 63,000 jobs, which is a strong indication a recession may be at hand. But the unemployment rate actually fell, to 4.8 percent from 4.9 percent.

articles.headline: In 2 Battlegrounds, Voters Say, Not Yet
articles.snippet: Barack Obama holds the delegate lead, but Hillary Rodham Clinton showed she can win the big states.
articles.abstract: Barack Obama holds the delegate lead, but Hillary Rodham Clinton showed she can win the big states.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton’s victories in Ohio and Texas on Tuesday night not only shook off the vapors of impending defeat, but also showed that  in spite of his delegate lead  Senator Barack Obama was still losing to her in the big states.

articles.headline: Colombia Is Flashpoint in Chávez’s Feud With U.S.
articles.snippet: A three-country dispute highlights the fact that Colombia is increasingly seen in Venezuela as an American proxy.
articles.abstract: A three-country dispute highlights the fact that Colombia is increasingly seen in Venezuela as an American proxy.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela  In the four days since Colombian forces crossed into Ecuador and killed a guerrilla leader taking refuge there, tensions between Colombia  Washington’s top regional ally  and its leftist neighbors have erupted, highlighting the fact that Colombia and its policies are increasingly viewed here as American proxies.

articles.headline: Big Wins for Clinton in Texas and Ohio; McCain Clinches Race as Foe Concedes
articles.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s victories over Barack Obama in Ohio and Texas gave her a chance to soldier on. John McCain claimed the G.O.P. nomination.
articles.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s victories over Barack Obama in Ohio and Texas gave her a chance to soldier on. John McCain claimed the G.O.P. nomination.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton defeated Senator Barack Obama in Ohio and Texas on Tuesday, ending a string of defeats and allowing her to soldier on in a Democratic presidential nomination race that now seems unlikely to end any time soon.

articles.headline: Hollywood on Edge of Its Seats as Wiretapping Trial Is Set to Start
articles.snippet: The case of Anthony Pellicano, the onetime sleuth-to-the-stars who is accused of eavesdropping, has a D-list of no-name defendants but big names may be called to testify.
articles.abstract: The case of Anthony Pellicano, the onetime sleuth-to-the-stars who is accused of eavesdropping, has a D-list of no-name defendants but big names may be called to testify.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  More than five years have gone by since a Hollywood reporter who had been menacingly warned off of a story learned that her phones had also been tapped. On Wednesday, Anthony Pellicano, the onetime sleuth-to-the-stars accused of that eavesdropping, will go on trial here on racketeering charges in a case that has alternately seized the entertainment industry’s attention and left it wondering what all the fuss was about.

articles.headline: Bush and Fed Step Toward a Mortgage Rescue
articles.snippet: The Bush administration and the Federal Reserve are inching closer toward a government rescue of distressed homeowners and mortgage lenders.
articles.abstract: The Bush administration and the Federal Reserve are inching closer toward a government rescue of distressed homeowners and mortgage lenders.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  However much they might oppose it on ideological grounds, the Bush administration and the Federal Reserve are inching closer toward a government rescue of distressed homeowners and mortgage lenders.
articles.byline: By Edmund L. Andrews and Vikas Bajaj
